script:
import sys
from awsglue.transforms import *
from awsglue.utils import getResolvedOptions
from awsglue.context import GlueContext
from awsglue.job import Job
from pyspark.context import SparkContext
from pyspark.sql import functions as F

# ----------------------------
# Job Setup
# ----------------------------
args = getResolvedOptions(sys.argv, ['JOB_NAME'])
sc = SparkContext()
glueContext = GlueContext(sc)
spark = glueContext.spark_session
job = Job(glueContext)
job.init(args['JOB_NAME'], args)

# ----------------------------
# Step 1️⃣: Read Bronze Data
# ----------------------------
bronze_path = "s3://marketing-calendly-project/bronze/calendly/"
bronze_df = glueContext.create_dynamic_frame.from_options(
    connection_type="s3",
    connection_options={"paths": [bronze_path]},
    format="json"
).toDF()

print("✅ Bronze schema:")
bronze_df.printSchema()

# ----------------------------
# Step 2️⃣: Rename Columns (if needed)
# ----------------------------
# If your columns already are invitee_email/invitee_name — we just pass them through
df_silver = bronze_df.select(
    F.col("event"),
    F.col("invitee_email"),
    F.col("invitee_name")
)

# ----------------------------
# Step 3️⃣: Write to Silver Zone
# ----------------------------
silver_path = "s3://marketing-calendly-project/silver/calendly/"
df_silver.write.mode("overwrite").parquet(silver_path)

print(f"✅ Silver layer successfully written to {silver_path}")

job.commit()
